roleset.name: pledge, designate to
roleset.note: COMMIT-V NOTES: Member of VNcls dedicate-79, confine-92-1. (from commit.01-v)
COMMITMENT-N NOTES: Member of VNcls dedicate-79, confine-92-1. (from commitment.01-n)
COMMITTED-J NOTES: Based on Thyme and Sharp data. Comparison to commit.01. Commit.01 is a member of VN classes dedicate-79 and confine-92.1.Framed by Katie. (from committed.01-j)

example.name: just transitive
example.text: The banks jointly committed $1.2 billion of financing, subject to certain conditions, McCaw said.
example.arg: $1.2 billion of financing, subject to certain conditions

example.name: passive with committed-to
example.text: ``This tells you AT& T-1 is serious about continuing to manage their cost structure and is committed *trace*-1 to 20%-a-year earnings growth,'' said Jack Grubman, an analyst with PaineWebber Inc.

example.name: passive often interpreted as ADJP
example.text: In an interview Wednesday with Dow Jones Professional Investor Report, Mr. Stevens said, ``We're in no way committed to a deal going through at all.
example.arg: to a deal going through at all

example.name: but not always
example.text: He added [the airline]-1 isn't committed *trace*-1 to going forward with any new bid, and hasn't participated in bankers' efforts to revive the transaction that collapsed.
example.arg: to going forward with any new bid

example.name: different sense, same syntax
example.text: Mary committed John to a mental asylum.

example.name: within LVC
example.text: At the same time , Viacom is trying to persuade stations-2 *-2 to make commitments to `` A Different World , '' a spin - off of `` Cosby '' whose reruns will become available in 1991 .
example.arg: to `` A Different World , '' a spin - off of `` Cosby '' whose reruns will become available in 1991 .

example.name: All arguments
example.text: Each organization was chosen by the SIMA Environmental Fund Board of Directors based on their commitment of funds to specific projects.

example.name: Args 1, 2
example.text: Our team is committed to minimizing or preventing chemotherapy toxicity.
example.arg: to minimizing or preventing chemotherapy toxicity.

example.name: I am not a criminal!
example.text: Yesterday, U.S. Judge Alcee Hastings faced his jury -- the full U.S. Senate -- and said, ``I-1 am not guilty of *trace*-1 having committed any crime.''
